summary: This is the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) and Addendum between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida and Jeffrey Epstein. It details the terms under which federal prosecution for sex trafficking and related offenses would be deferred in exchange for Epstein pleading guilty to state charges, serving a specific sentence, and providing compensation to identified victims. The agreement also includes a controversial provision granting immunity to potential co-conspirators.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the investigation and agreement. He agrees to plead guilty to state charges, serve a specific sentence, and provide compensation to victims in exchange for deferred federal prosecution.

persons.name: R. Alexander Acosta
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of Florida
persons.context: The U.S. Attorney who authorized the Non-Prosecution Agreement, deferring federal prosecution of Epstein.

persons.name: Gerald Lefcourt
persons.context: One of Epstein's attorneys who signed the Non-Prosecution Agreement and its Addendum.

persons.name: Lilly Ann Sanchez
persons.context: One of Epstein's attorneys who signed the Non-Prosecution Agreement and its Addendum.

connections.description: Prosecutor-defendant relationship formalized through the Non-Prosecution Agreement, where Acosta's office agrees to defer prosecution in exchange for Epstein's compliance with specific terms.
Lefcourt is identified as counsel to Jeffrey Epstein and signed the legal agreement on his behalf.
Sanchez is identified as an attorney for Jeffrey Epstein and signed the legal agreement on his behalf.

events.title: Deadline for Epstein's Guilty Plea and Sentencing
events.description: The agreement stipulates Epstein shall use his best efforts to enter his guilty plea and be sentenced not later than this date.

events.title: Deadline for Epstein to Self-Report to Begin Sentence
events.description: The United States had no objection to Epstein self-reporting to begin serving his sentence not later than this date.

events.title: Federal Investigation Period
events.description: The period during which the U.S. Attorney's Office and FBI investigated offenses committed by Epstein against the United States, including sex trafficking of minors.

locations: 15th Judicial Circuit in and for Palm Beach County, Florida
keyFacts: The agreement granted Jeffrey Epstein and his potential co-conspirators immunity from federal prosecution for a range of serious offenses, including sex trafficking of minors, provided Epstein fulfilled the agreement's terms.

Epstein agreed to plead guilty to state charges (solicitation of prostitution and solicitation of minors for prostitution) and serve an 18-month county jail sentence followed by 12 months of community control.
The agreement required Epstein to provide financial compensation to identified victims through a court-approved process and attorney representative, whose fees he would pay.
The federal grand jury investigation was to be suspended and all pending subpoenas held in abeyance upon execution of the agreement, effectively halting the federal probe.
The document reveals the scope of the federal investigation, which included charges of conspiracy, interstate travel for illicit sexual conduct, and sex trafficking of minors under 18.
